title: Get Started
code: library(lavaan) #> This is lavaan 0.6-17 #> lavaan is FREE software! Please report any bugs. library(semlrtp) # Use a smaller sample to show the impact of using LRT p-values set.seed(1234) data(data_sem16) mod <- " f1 =~ x1 + x2 + x3 f2 =~ x5 + x6 + x7 f3 =~ x9 + x10 + x11 f4 =~ x13 + x14 + x15 f3 ~ f1 + f2 f4 ~ f3 " fit <- cfa(mod,            data_sem16,            group = "group") fit_nogp <- cfa(mod,                 data_sem16)

title: Get Started
text: Allow error variances
code: fit_lrtp <- lrtp(fit) fit_lrtp #>  #> Parameter Estimates: #>  #>   Standard errors                             Standard #>   Information                                 Expected #>   Information saturated (h1) model          Structured #>  #>  #> Group 1 [gamma]: #>  #> Regressions: #>                    Estimate  Std.Err    Chisq     LRTp #>   f3 ~                                                 #>     f1                0.718    0.269    6.235    0.013 #>     f2                0.765    0.322    6.499    0.011 #>   f4 ~                                                 #>     f3                0.499    0.130   32.074    0.000 #>  #> Covariances: #>                    Estimate  Std.Err    Chisq     LRTp #>   f1 ~~                                                #>     f2                0.116    0.052    8.709    0.003 #>  #>  #> Group 2 [alpha]: #>  #> Regressions: #>                    Estimate  Std.Err    Chisq     LRTp #>   f3 ~                                                 #>     f1                0.509    0.239    7.538    0.006 #>     f2               -0.033    0.156    0.036    0.849 #>   f4 ~                                                 #>     f3                0.740    0.268   18.860    0.000 #>  #> Covariances: #>                    Estimate  Std.Err    Chisq     LRTp #>   f1 ~~                                                #>     f2                0.082    0.060   Failed   Failed #>  #> NOTE: 'Failed' indicates that LRT p-value is requested but the  #> likelihood ratio test failed. fit_lrtp_b <- lrtp(fit,                    op = "~") fit_lrtp_b #>  #> Parameter Estimates: #>  #>   Standard errors                             Standard #>   Information                                 Expected #>   Information saturated (h1) model          Structured #>  #>  #> Group 1 [gamma]: #>  #> Regressions: #>                    Estimate  Std.Err    Chisq     LRTp #>   f3 ~                                                 #>     f1                0.718    0.269    6.235    0.013 #>     f2                0.765    0.322    6.499    0.011 #>   f4 ~                                                 #>     f3                0.499    0.130   32.074    0.000 #>  #>  #> Group 2 [alpha]: #>  #> Regressions: #>                    Estimate  Std.Err    Chisq     LRTp #>   f3 ~                                                 #>     f1                0.509    0.239    7.538    0.006 #>     f2               -0.033    0.156    0.036    0.849 #>   f4 ~                                                 #>     f3                0.740    0.268   18.860    0.000 fit_nogp_lrtp <- lrtp(fit_nogp) fit_nogp_lrtp #>  #> Parameter Estimates: #>  #>   Standard errors                             Standard #>   Information                                 Expected #>   Information saturated (h1) model          Structured #>  #> Regressions: #>                    Estimate  Std.Err    Chisq     LRTp #>   f3 ~                                                 #>     f1                0.656    0.191   13.381    0.000 #>     f2                0.347    0.179    4.016    0.045 #>   f4 ~                                                 #>     f3                0.602    0.131   44.155    0.000 #>  #> Covariances: #>                    Estimate  Std.Err    Chisq     LRTp #>   f1 ~~                                                #>     f2                0.099    0.039    9.729    0.002 fit_nogp_lrtp_b <- lrtp(fit_nogp,                         op = "~") fit_nogp_lrtp_b #>  #> Parameter Estimates: #>  #>   Standard errors                             Standard #>   Information                                 Expected #>   Information saturated (h1) model          Structured #>  #> Regressions: #>                    Estimate  Std.Err    Chisq     LRTp #>   f3 ~                                                 #>     f1                0.656    0.191   13.381    0.000 #>     f2                0.347    0.179    4.016    0.045 #>   f4 ~                                                 #>     f3                0.602    0.131   44.155    0.000 fit_nogp_lrtp_evar <- lrtp(fit_nogp,                            no_error_variances = FALSE) fit_nogp_lrtp_evar #>  #> Parameter Estimates: #>  #>   Standard errors                             Standard #>   Information                                 Expected #>   Information saturated (h1) model          Structured #>  #> Regressions: #>                    Estimate  Std.Err    Chisq     LRTp #>   f3 ~                                                 #>     f1                0.656    0.191   13.381    0.000 #>     f2                0.347    0.179    4.016    0.045 #>   f4 ~                                                 #>     f3                0.602    0.131   44.155    0.000 #>  #> Covariances: #>                    Estimate  Std.Err    Chisq     LRTp #>   f1 ~~                                                #>     f2                0.099    0.039    9.729    0.002 #>  #> Variances: #>                    Estimate  Std.Err    Chisq     LRTp #>     x1                1.019    0.101   35.764    0.000 #>     x2                1.107    0.100   48.279    0.000 #>     x3                0.653    0.092   17.071    0.000 #>     x5                0.917    0.108   15.593    0.000 #>     x6                0.864    0.121   11.322    0.001 #>     x7                1.067    0.092   32.796    0.000 #>     x9                0.963    0.105   49.525    0.000 #>     x10               1.037    0.098   70.760    0.000 #>     x11               0.943    0.097   57.873    0.000 #>     x13               1.100    0.122   23.582    0.000 #>     x14               1.131    0.128   22.152    0.000 #>     x15               1.071    0.088   57.325    0.000 #>    .f3                0.293    0.083   20.443    0.000 #>    .f4 Numeric. x8 Indicator. Numeric. x9 Indicator. Numeric. x10 Indicator. Numeric. x11 Indicator. Numeric. x12 Indicator. Numeric. x13 Indicator. Numeric. x14 Indicator. Numeric. x15 Indicator. what: Fix a Free Parameter To Zero And Fit a Model Again — fix_to_zero
title: Fix a Free Parameter To Zero And Fit a Model Again — fix_to_zero
text: fixes designated free parameter lavaan object zero refit model.

title: Fix a Free Parameter To Zero And Fit a Model Again — fix_to_zero
Fix a Free Parameter To Zero And Fit a Model Again — fix_to_zero
text: fit lavaan-class object. par_id integer. row number free parameter parameter table fit fixed. store_fit Logical. TRUE, fit stored output. Default FALSE.

title: Fix a Free Parameter To Zero And Fit a Model Again — fix_to_zero
text: fix_to_zero-class object, list elements:call fit0 lavaan output refitted object. NA fit failed reasons. model must converged, passed lavaan's post check, variance covariance matrix estimates can computed, one degree freedom original model considered acceptable. fit1 original lavaan output store_fit TRUE. NULL otherwise par_id row number designated free parameter. call original call function. ptable0 parameter table designated parameter fixed zero. can used diagnostic purpose fit failed. fit0_error error message refitting, . error, `NA``. vcov_ok TRUE variance covariance matrix estimates can computed without error warning. FALSE otherwise. vcov_msg message generated using lavaan::lavInspect() get variance-covariance matrix parameter estimates refitted model. TRUE, error warning. Can used diagnostic purposes. converged: Whether modified model converged. post_check_passed: Whether solution modified model passed lavaans post check. fit_not_ok: fit failed reasons, fit object, available, stored element rather fit0. fit object can retrieved diagnostic purposed necessary. df_diff_one: Whether difference model degrees freedom modified model original model one.

title: Fix a Free Parameter To Zero And Fit a Model Again — fix_to_zero
text: modifies parameter table lavaan-class object fits model .

title: Fix a Free Parameter To Zero And Fit a Model Again — fix_to_zero
text: Shu Fai Cheung https://orcid.org/0000-0002-9871-9448

title: Fix a Free Parameter To Zero And Fit a Model Again — fix_to_zero
code: library(lavaan) data(data_sem16) mod <- " f1 =~ x1 + x2 + x3 f2 =~ x4 + x5 + x6 " fit <- sem(mod, data_sem16) # Fix the factor covariance to zero out <- fix_to_zero(fit, par_id = 15) summary(out$fit0) #> lavaan 0.6.17 ended normally after 49 iterations #>  #>   Estimator                                         ML #>   Optimization method                           NLMINB #>   Number of model parameters                        12 #>  #>   Number of observations                           336 #>  #> Model Test User Model: #>                                                        #>   Test statistic                                27.655 #>   Degrees of freedom                                 9 #>   P-value (Chi-square)                           0.001 #>  #> Parameter Estimates: #>  #>   Standard errors                             Standard #>   Information                                 Expected #>   Information saturated (h1) model          Structured #>  #> Latent Variables: #>                    Estimate  Std.Err  z-value  P(>|z|) #>   f1 =~                                                #>     x1                1.000                            #>     x2                0.911    0.253    3.604    0.000 #>     x3                1.051    0.323    3.257    0.001 #>   f2 =~                                                #>     x4                1.000                            #>     x5                2.538    1.424    1.782    0.075 #>     x6                5.526    6.331    0.873    0.383 #>  #> Covariances: #>                    Estimate  Std.Err  z-value  P(>|z|) #>   f1 ~~                                                #>     f2                0.000                            #>  #> Variances: #>                    Estimate  Std.Err  z-value  P(>|z|) #>    .x1                1.010    0.119    8.457    0.000 #>    .x2                1.067    0.111    9.573    0.000 #>    .x3                0.700    0.114    6.159    0.000 #>    .x4 what: Fix a Free Parameter to Zero and do LR Test — lrt
title: Fix a Free Parameter to Zero and do LR Test — lrt
text: Fix designated free parameter zero likelihood ratio test.

title: Fix a Free Parameter to Zero and do LR Test — lrt
code: lrt(fit, par_id, store_fit = FALSE, group = NULL)

title: Fix a Free Parameter to Zero and do LR Test — lrt
text: fit lavaan-class object. par_id can integer. string. integer, row number free parameter parameter table fit fixed. string, must valid lavaan model syntax, label labelled parameter. store_fit Logical. TRUE, fit stored output. Default FALSE. group model syntax used par_id model multigroup model, either group label group number parameter.

title: Fix a Free Parameter to Zero and do LR Test — lrt
text: lrt-class object, list following elements: lrt: output lavaan::lavTestLRT(). error message warning, set NA. par_id: row number designated free parameters. fit1: original lavaan output, store_fit TRUE. NA otherwise. fix_to_zero: output fit_to_zero(). call: call function. lrt_status: Integer. 0, error warning likelihood ratio test lavaan::lavTestLRT() returns table (data.frame) test. -1, something wrong, e.g., error warning occurred. lrt_msg: something wrong likelihood ratio test, error warning message. error warning, NA.

title: Fix a Free Parameter to Zero and do LR Test — lrt
text: fixes designated free parameter lavaan output, refit model, likelihood ratio test comparing model original model.

title: Fix a Free Parameter to Zero and do LR Test — lrt
text: Shu Fai Cheung https://orcid.org/0000-0002-9871-9448

title: Fix a Free Parameter to Zero and do LR Test — lrt
code: library(lavaan) data(data_sem16) mod <- " f1 =~ x1 + x2 + x3 f2 =~ x4 + x5 + x6 " fit <- sem(mod, data_sem16) # Fix the factor covariance to zero out <- lrt(fit, par_id = 15) out$lrt #>  #> Chi-Squared Difference Test #>  #>      Df    AIC    BIC  Chisq Chisq diff   RMSEA Df diff Pr(>Chisq)    #> fit   8 6024.1 6073.7 17.009                                          #> fit0  9 6032.8 6078.6 27.655     10.646 0.16943       1   0.001103 ** #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 ‘***’ 0.001 ‘**’ 0.01 ‘*’ 0.05 ‘.’ 0.1 ‘ ’ 1 parameterEstimates(fit)[15, ] #>    lhs op rhs   est    se     z pvalue ci.lower ci.upper #> 15  f1 ~~  f2 0.057 0.028 2.005  0.045    0.001    0.112 parameterEstimates(out$fix_to_zero$fit0)[15, ] #>    lhs op rhs est se  z pvalue ci.lower ci.upper #> 15  f1 ~~  f2   0  0 NA     NA        0        0  # Can use model syntax for par_id  out <- lrt(fit, par_id = "f1 =~ x3") out$lrt #>  #> Chi-Squared Difference Test #>  #>      Df    AIC    BIC  Chisq Chisq diff   RMSEA Df diff Pr(>Chisq)     #> fit   8 6024.1 6073.7 17.009                                           #> fit0  9 6061.7 6107.5 56.566     39.557 0.33875       1  3.186e-10 *** #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 ‘***’ 0.001 ‘**’ 0.01 ‘*’ 0.05 ‘.’ 0.1 ‘ ’ 1

title: Likelihood Ratio Test P-Values — lrtp
text: Compute likelihood ratio test p-values free parameters lavaan output.

title: Likelihood Ratio Test P-Values — lrtp
code: lrtp(   fit,   op = c("~", "~~"),   no_variances = TRUE,   no_error_variances = TRUE,   no_error_covariances = TRUE,   ... )

title: Likelihood Ratio Test P-Values — lrtp
text: fit lavaan-class object. op character vector lavaan model syntax operators. Free parameters operators included, unless excluded arguments. Default c("~", "~~"). no_variances Logical. TRUE, default, free variances excluded. (Error variances handled no_error_variances.) no_error_variances Logical, TRUE, default, free error variances excluded. no_error_covariances Logical. TRUE, default, free error covariances excluded. ... Optional arguments passed lavaan::parameterEstimates().

title: Likelihood Ratio Test P-Values — lrtp
text: lrt-class object, data-frame-like object output lavaan::parameterEstimates(), column LRTp LRT p-values. print method print.lrtp().

title: Likelihood Ratio Test P-Values — lrtp
text: find free parameters lavaan-class object, compute likelihood ratio test (LRT) p-value fixed zero, return parameter estimates data frame LRT p-values included.

title: Likelihood Ratio Test P-Values — lrtp
text: Shu Fai Cheung https://orcid.org/0000-0002-9871-9448

title: Likelihood Ratio Test P-Values — lrtp
code: library(lavaan) data(data_sem16) mod <- " f1 =~ x1 + x2 + x3 f2 =~ x4 + x5 + x6 f3 =~ x7 + x8 + x9 f4 =~ x10 + x11 + x12 f2 ~~ f1 f3 ~ f1 + f2 f4 ~ f3 " fit <- sem(mod, data_sem16) lrtp(fit) #>  #> Parameter Estimates: #>  #>   Standard errors                             Standard #>   Information                                 Expected #>   Information saturated (h1) model          Structured #>  #> Regressions: #>                    Estimate  Std.Err    Chisq     LRTp #>   f3 ~                                                 #>     f1                0.248    0.097   10.343    0.001 #>     f2                0.292    0.199    3.778    0.052 #>   f4 ~                                                 #>     f3                2.118    0.684   86.205    0.000 #>  #> Covariances: #>                    Estimate  Std.Err    Chisq     LRTp #>   f1 ~~                                                #>     f2                0.039    0.022    9.717    0.002 #>  lrtp(fit, op = "~") #>  #> Parameter Estimates: #>  #>   Standard errors                             Standard #>   Information                                 Expected #>   Information saturated (h1) model          Structured #>  #> Regressions: #>                    Estimate  Std.Err    Chisq     LRTp #>   f3 ~                                                 #>     f1                0.248    0.097   10.343    0.001 #>     f2                0.292    0.199    3.778    0.052 #>   f4 ~                                                 #>     f3                2.118    0.684   86.205    0.000 #>

what: Print a lrt- Class Object — print.lrt
title: Print a lrt- Class Object — print.lrt
text: Print content lrt-class object.

title: Print a lrt- Class Object — print.lrt
code: # S3 method for lrt print(x, digits = 3, ...)

title: Print a lrt- Class Object — print.lrt
text: x lrt-class object. digits Integer. number decimal places print. Default 3. ... Optional arguments. used.

title: Print a lrt- Class Object — print.lrt
text: x returned invisibly. Called side effect.

title: Print a lrt- Class Object — print.lrt
text: print method output lrt().

title: Print a lrt- Class Object — print.lrt
text: Shu Fai Cheung https://orcid.org/0000-0002-9871-9448

title: Print a lrt- Class Object — print.lrt
code: library(lavaan) data(data_sem16) mod <- " f1 =~ x1 + x2 + x3 f2 =~ x4 + x5 + x6 " fit <- sem(mod, data_sem16)  out <- lrt(fit, par_id = "f1 ~~ f2") out #>  #> ==== LRT p-value ==== #>  #> Parameter: f1~~f2  #>  #> LRT test with the selected parameter fixed to zero: #>  #> Chi-Squared Difference Test #>  #>      Df  AIC  BIC Chisq Chisq diff RMSEA Df diff Pr(>Chisq)    #> fit   8 6024 6074  17.0                                        #> fit0  9 6033 6079  27.6       10.7 0.169       1     0.0011 ** #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 ‘***’ 0.001 ‘**’ 0.01 ‘*’ 0.05 ‘.’ 0.1 ‘ ’ 1

what: Print a lrtp- Class Object — print.lrtp
title: Print a lrtp- Class Object — print.lrtp
text: Print content lrtp-class object.

title: Print a lrtp- Class Object — print.lrtp
code: # S3 method for lrtp print(   x,   digits = 3,   lrtp_only = TRUE,   wald_stats = FALSE,   output = c("text", "data.frame"),   ... )

title: Print a lrtp- Class Object — print.lrtp
text: x lrtp-class object. digits Integer. number decimal places print. Default 3. lrtp_only Logical. TRUE, default, parameters LRT p-values printed. wald_stats Logical. TRUE, usual Wald statistics (e.g., z statistics, p-values, CIs) printed. FALSE default, assuming users prefer using LRT statistics. output format printout. "text", style summary() lavaan-class object used. "data.frame", data frame format lavaan::parameterEstimates() used. ... Optional arguments. used.

title: Print a lrtp- Class Object — print.lrtp
text: x returned invisibly. Called side effect.

title: Print a lrtp- Class Object — print.lrtp
text: print method output lrtp().

title: Print a lrtp- Class Object — print.lrtp
text: Shu Fai Cheung https://orcid.org/0000-0002-9871-9448

title: Print a lrtp- Class Object — print.lrtp
code: library(lavaan) data(data_sem16) mod <- " f1 =~ x1 + x2 + x3 f2 =~ x4 + x5 + x6 " fit <- sem(mod, data_sem16)  out <- lrtp(fit) out #>  #> Parameter Estimates: #>  #>   Standard errors Std.Err    Chisq     LRTp #>   f1 ~~                                                #>     f2                0.057    0.028   10.646    0.001 #>  print(out, lrtp_only = FALSE) #>  #> Parameter Estimates: #>  #>   Standard errors                             Standard #>   Information                                 Expected #>   Information saturated (h1) model          Structured #>  #> Latent Variables: #>                    Estimate  Std.Err    Chisq     LRTp #>   f1 =~                                                #>     x1                1.000                NA       NA #>     x2                0.963    0.252       NA       NA #>     x3                1.054    0.284       NA       NA #>   f2 =~                                                #>     x4                1.000                NA       NA #>     x5                1.771    0.740       NA       NA #>     x6                2.368    1.060       NA       NA #>  #> Covariances: #>                    Estimate  Std.Err    Chisq     LRTp #>   f1 ~~                                                #>     f2                0.057    0.028   10.646    0.001 #>  #> Variances: #>                    Estimate  Std.Err    Chisq     LRTp #>    .x1                1.020    0.111       NA       NA #>    .x2                1.048    0.109       NA       NA #>    .x3                0.709    0.100       NA       NA #>    .x4                1.154    0.096       NA       NA #>    .x5                0.972    0.114       NA       NA #>    .x6                0.826    0.162       NA       NA #>     f1                0.276    0.100       NA       NA #>     f2                0.067    0.048       NA       NA #>

title: semlrtp 0.0.0.9023
text: Initialized package. (0.0.0.9000) Setup pkgdown site. (0.0.0.9001) Added dataset testing. Added free_pars() (internal function), tests. (0.0.0.9002) Added fix_to_zero(), tests. (0.0.0.9002) Added lrt(), tests. (0.0.0.9003) Added lrtp() print method, tests. (0.0.0.9004) Added vignette, Get Started. (0.0.0.9005) Fixed issues vignettes. (0.0.0.9006) Moved “TODOs” issues. (0.0.0.9007) default, method print.lrtp() print Wald statistics (z statistics, Wald p-values, Wald confidence intervals). (0.0.0.9008) chi-squared difference LRT p-value also printed. (0.0.0.9009) Fixed bug inserting columns lrtp(). (0.0.0.9010) free_pars() can identify apparently free parameters actually fixed due equality constraint constant. (0.0.0.9011) Updated fix_to_zero() check whether requested parameter successfully fixed zero. (0.0.0.9012) Updated fix_to_zero() handle parameters involved internal equality constraint (e.g, constrained equal groups group.equal argument lavaan::lavaan()). (0.0.0.9013) Updated fix_to_zero() handle labelled parameters. (0.0.0.9014) Updated fix_to_zero() check VCOV modified model. failed get VCOV, modified model may identified. (0.0.0.9015) Updated lrt(), lrtp(), print.lrtp() handle error LR test. (0.0.0.9016) Updated theme pkgdown site. (0.0.0.9017) Revised several functions problems fitting modified model recorded, instead raising error. structure output lrt() fix_to_zero() also modified include indicators error. avoid unnecessarily storing many copies original fit object, change made output lrt() times break code previous versions semlrtp. (0.0.0.9018) no_variances lrtp() revised handle variances, error variances. (0.0.0.9019) Fixed bug labelled variance. (0.0.0.9020) Added internal function lhs_to_par_id() converting model syntax string parameter table row number. (0.0.0.9021) Updated lrt() allow users use model syntax parameter label specify target parameter. (0.0.0.9022) Added print method output lrt(). (0.0.0.9023)
